PA, Lancaster

Apply Now

Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories, a nationally recognized laboratory, is searching for a Scientist to support our Medical Device Microbiology group in Lancaster, PA.

Summary:

Performing a variety of analytical tasks for the analysis of drug products and their raw materials; preparing samples for analysis and running some instrumentation with minimum supervision including, but not limited to, UV/Spec, pH, HPLC, Capillary electrophoresis, traditional gel electrophoresis, microbiology, and various wet chemistry analyses; working efficiently, documenting work clearly, and performing tests accurately.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Applies GMP/GLP in all areas of responsibility, as appropriate

Demonstrates and promotes the company vision

Regular attendance and punctuality

Read and understand analytical procedures

Perform primary analytical techniques (i.e. SDS-PAGE, IEF, Western Blot, Chromatography such as reversed-phase, size exclusion and ion exchange, techniques such as amino acid analysis and peptide mapping)

Perform laboratory operations with good dexterity and laboratory techniques with a high degree of accuracy and precision

Document testing, observations, deviations, and results clearly and completely

Understand and mainstain laboratory equipment

Understand and perform calculations as required by testing methods (some derivation of equations may be required) then review, approve, and communicate data verbally and in written format

Prepare documents including, but not limited to, analytical procedures, standard operating procedures, investigations and explanations of analytical areas

Cross train and provide assistance (if required) in other areas of the laboratory

Understand and utilize computers for information access, calculations, and report preparation

Perform method transfers and feasibility studies

Self-teach new analytical procedures and/or computer procedures

Perform laboratory maintenance

Ability to wear a respirator when necessary

Education:

Bachelor's Degree in biochemistry, biology, chemistry or protein chemistry.

Experience:

2-4 years related experience.

GMP, Aseptic gowning/operations experience

Position is full-time, Mon-Fri 8:00 AM- 4:30 PM., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, Pennsylvania are encouraged to apply.

As a Eurofins Lancaster Labs employee, you will become part of a company that has received national recognition as a great place to work. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays and vacation, personal days, and dental and vision options.
